dublin_core.dcvalue: An implantable cardioverter defibrillator ICD experienced electromagnetic interference from a laptop computer s hard disk The patient with the ICD was using his laptop computer at home while lying on his bed The laptop was positioned on his chest when he heard a beeping sound from the ICD indicating magnet mode conversion This situation was replicated in a controlled environment and the conversion was found to be due to the static magnetic field produced by the laptop s hard disk The ICD s conversion to magnet mode can be dangerous because it ends all tachyarrhythmia detections and therapies
Inappropriate implantable cardioverter-defibrillator magnet-mode switch induced by a laptop computer.
